about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:

about.name: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:

hasPart.assesses: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check: | To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

comment.text: The inside rearview mirror.
The outside rearview mirror.
Over your shoulders.
Over your shoulders.

answerExplanation.text: By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

comment.text: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check: | By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

hasPart.name: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:

about.name: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:

hasPart.assesses: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from: | To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Any lane (as long as it is safe).

comment.text: Any lane (as long as it is safe).

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane closest to the left curb.

comment.text: The lane closest to the left curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane in the center of the road.

comment.text: The lane in the center of the road.

acceptedAnswer.text: The lane closest to the left curb.

comment.text: The lane closest to the left curb.

answerExplanation.text: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

comment.text: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from: | When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

hasPart.name: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should:

about.name: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should:

hasPart.assesses: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should: | Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Hydroplaning is caused by driving too fast on a wet road. Slow down when driving on wet pavement to prevent hydroplaning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.

comment.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
Slow down.

suggestedAnswer.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.

comment.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.
Slow down.

answerExplanation.text: Hydroplaning is caused by driving too fast on a wet road. Slow down when driving on wet pavement to prevent hydroplaning.

comment.text: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should: | Hydroplaning is caused by driving too fast on a wet road. Slow down when driving on wet pavement to prevent hydroplaning.

hasPart.name: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

about.name: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

hasPart.assesses: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? | Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

comment.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.

comment.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

comment.text: Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

comment.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

answerExplanation.text: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

comment.text: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? | You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

hasPart.name: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except:

about.name: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except:

hasPart.assesses: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except: | Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Prior to entering your vehicle, check your surroundings to be aware of any potential hazards. When you are backing out of a parking space, look over your shoulder to maintain awareness of your surroundings.

suggestedAnswer.text: Looking over your right shoulder as you back up.

comment.text: Looking over your right shoulder as you back up.
Checking your vehicle's surroundings.

suggestedAnswer.text: Tapping your horn before you back up.

comment.text: Tapping your horn before you back up.

acceptedAnswer.text: Tapping your horn before you back up.

comment.text: Tapping your horn before you back up.

answerExplanation.text: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Prior to entering your vehicle, check your surroundings to be aware of any potential hazards. When you are backing out of a parking space, look over your shoulder to maintain awareness of your surroundings.

comment.text: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except: | Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Prior to entering your vehicle, check your surroundings to be aware of any potential hazards. When you are backing out of a parking space, look over your shoulder to maintain awareness of your surroundings.

hasPart.name: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car:

about.name: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car:

hasPart.assesses: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car: | To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.

comment.text: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay focused on the centerline on the road.

comment.text: Stay focused on the centerline on the road.
Flash your high beams.

acceptedAnswer.text: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.

comment.text: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.

answerExplanation.text: You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.

comment.text: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car: | You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.
